evidence.text: The Memorandum (page 1) states the case involves "a motion for a temporary restraining order" seeking to prevent "Defendants from taking any steps to defund the Bureau". The Docket entries show no mention of a monitor, and the case was dismissed without any reference to monitoring requirements. The CFPB's statutory monitoring functions (e.g., "monitoring risks to consumers") are part of its routine duties, not a court-appointed monitor.
